There are numerous elements making the price of a litre of petrol or diesel:  
a) Government duty and tax (66%)
b) The cost of petrol and diesel on the open market - (28%)
c) The costs and profit of the wholesaler & retailer - Retail/Ex-Refinery spread (6%)

We‚Äôve hooked up with tech company Calysta that makes fish food from #naturalgas. It‚Äôs another great example of how we are investing in new #energy solutions that create #morefromless

Sound fishy?üêüFollow the thread for 5 quick facts about @FeedKind & the benefits of this tech‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/ZLFgzte22I

1‚É£@FeedKind can help address global food security

‚û°Ô∏èDemand for protein-based animal feed is expected to rise by up to 70% by 2050 - The world‚Äôs land and oceans simply can‚Äôt fulfil this demand without innovative solutions that secure the population‚Äôs need to eat
2‚É£Calysta has developed a gas fermentation process, which uses a naturally occurring bacteria to convert methane into protein feed & chemicals https://t.co/RGm8GavDOu

3‚É£Wait what? ü§î

‚û°Ô∏èThe process is similar to making yeast for bread. A naturally occurring bacteria is grown in a proprietary fermenter using methane as its carbon & energy source - this creates a single cell protein that will be harvested & dried prior to being pelletised https://t.co/PXMQ589vdD

4‚É£FeedKind production has no impact on agricultural land and uses little water

Bob Dudley set out the important role that energy majors like #BP have to play in getting to a net-zero emissions world during a speech @ChathamHouse tonight. #chevents https://t.co/habwLmD7YS

He said: ‚ÄòBecause of our technical capabilities, financial resources & global reach, we‚Äôre not just part of the future, we‚Äôre an important part of the solution.‚Äô #chevents https://t.co/9k0XMbSAVB
Read his speech in full here: https://t.co/ksLBPZume1 #chevents

Bob Dudley spoke with @EvanHD @ChathamHouse last night about #BP‚Äôs future & our role in solving the #dualchallenge of increasing demands for energy and the need for a dramatic reduction in emissions

‚¨áÔ∏èRead what he in the thread below‚¨áÔ∏è
Like our critics, BP believes the world is not on a sustainable path. Like our critics, we also support a rapid transition to a lower carbon future
If dithering & delay today lead to an abrupt, precipitous course-correction tomorrow, that could be highly disruptive for business & the world economy. So, we need to get on with it
BP also agrees with its critics on the need for the world to move to net zero emissions. BP applauds the UK government‚Äôs ambition to reach net zero even sooner, by mid-century

Here‚Äôs one more area where there‚Äôs a high level of agreement - the necessary components for a net-zero world: Zero-carbon power keeping us warm & the lights on‚Ä¶provided largely by renewables & supported by decarbonized gas including the use of carbon capture use & storage (CCUS)
Streets humming with electric and hydrogen-powered cars and the skies and seas being navigated by planes and ships powered by biofuels and hydrogen

It‚Äôs a world where people and businesses will have moved away from a throw-away culture and are embracing the circular economy‚Ä¶Where we harness nature‚Äôs power to reduce emissions ‚Äì through planting trees and nurturing peatlands
Read his speech in full here: https://t.co/ksLBPZume1  #chevents
